required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Outcomes of Implantationof Black Diaphragm Intraocular Lens in Complete Aniridia and Aphakia Due to Posttraumatic Eye Rupture
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Outcomes of Implantationof Black Diaphragm Intraocular Lens in Complete Aniridia and Aphakia Due to Posttraumatic Eye Rupture

brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose: To assess long-term outcomes of implantation of black diaphragmintraocular lens (BD IOL) in postraumatic aniridia and aphakia due to eye rupture.
METHODS: This is retrospective consecutive case series of 14 eyes with post-traumatic complete aniridia and aphakia treated withscleral fixation of BD IOL with. Measurements included ophthalmological comorbidities, best corrected visual acuity (BCVA), complications, and postoperative interventions. The average postoperative follow-up period was 36 months.

primary_outcome.description: The visual acuity measurement with ETDRS chart
The anterior segment of the eye and eye fundus were examined.
The procedure was performed with the Goldman applanation tonometer.
Coexisting eye diseases and post-operative complications were noted.

clinical_study.condition: Eye; Rupture, Traumatic, With Loss of Intraocular Tissue

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group of 14 patients with post-traumatic complete anirirdia
arm_group.description: 14 eyes with post-traumatic complete aniridia and aphakia treated withscleral fixation of BD IOL with measurements included ophthalmological comorbidities, best corrected visual acuity (BCVA), complications, and postoperative interventions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
post-traumatic complete aniridia and aphakia
Exclusion Criteria:
active ocluar inflammation or infection

facility.name: General Department of Ophthalmology in Lublin
